alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Green Lake (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 8:09PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Green Lake and northeastern Columbia Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 808 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cambria, or 12 miles north of Columbus, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Randolph, Cambria, Manchester, Friesland, Kingston, and Dalton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
